docs.title: Home
docs.text: This is hosted in GitHub Pages. Happy Reading.

docs.title: How To Deploy
docs.text: Only manual deployment is supported. GitHub Pages for private repositories is not available for free tier.

docs.title: 1. Add Remote [Only Once]
docs.text: git remote add docs https://github.com/Solenergy-Systems-Inc/envision-standard-backend-docs.git

docs.title: 2. Deploy
docs.text: mkdocs gh-deploy -r docs

docs.title: BaseAuditDTO
docs.text: This is a parent class for DTOs that contains common audit-related fields.

docs.title: BaseAuditDTO
docs.text:
Attributes:

Name Type Description created_date_utc datetime updated_date_utc datetime

docs.title: [GET] chargerHistory
docs.text: /api/getChargerHistory

docs.title: ChargerHistoryRequestDTO
docs.text:
Attributes:

Name Type Description site_id str

site id of the charger

charger_id str

id of the charger

start str

start datetime in %Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S

end str

end datetime in %Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S

type str

Indicates whether the charger is from a commericial or condominium site

num_transactions str

number of transactions to be retrieved

docs.title: ChargerHistoryResponseDTO
docs.text:
Attributes:

Name Type Description charger_history List[Union[dict, ChargerHistoryDTO]]

list of transaction details

total Union[dict, ChargerHistoryTotalDTO]

dictionary of total kwh consumed and total duration of charging

docs.title: ChargerHistoryDTO
docs.text:
Attributes:

Name Type Description ref_num str

str - transaction id

connector str

str - connector type

email str

str - email address of the driver

start_time str

str - start time of charging

duration str

str - duration of charging

kwh float

float - total kwh consumed

cost float

float - total cost of charging

docs.title: ChargerHistoryTotalDTO
docs.text:
Attributes:

Name Type Description kwh float

float - total kwh consumed

duration Union[timedelta, str]

timedelta - total duration of charging

docs.title: [GET] chargerInfo
docs.text: /api/chargerInfo

docs.title: ChargerInfoRequestDTO
docs.text:
Attributes:

Name Type Description charger_id str

(str) Assigned ID of the charger on site

site_id str

(str) Site id of the transaction

docs.title: ChargerInfoDTO
docs.text:
Attributes:

Name Type Description name str

name of the charger

model str

model of the charger

vendor str

brand of the charger

serial_num str

unique serial number of the charger issued by the vendor

conn_status list

list of ConnInfoDTO

docs.title: ConnectorInfoDTO
docs.text:
Attributes:

Name Type Description id str

email associated with the current charging session. null by default

type str

connector type

status str

status of the connector

docs.title: Possible Error Codes
docs.text:
• WRONG_PARAMS - Client side error. Wrong parameters were given
  • SITE_NOT_EXIST - Invalid site id given

docs.title: [GET] chargerMeterGraph
docs.text: /api/chargerMeterGraph

docs.title: ChargerMeterGraphRequestDTO
docs.text:
Attributes:

Name Type Description site_id str

assigned site id

start str

start datetime in the format of %Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S

end str

end datetime in the format of %Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S

tz str

timezone of the user

graph_type str

bar or graph

user_id str

id of the user

docs.title: ChargerMeterGraphResponseDTO
docs.text:
Attributes:

Name Type Description charger_meter_data list

datapoints for the graph

order list

order of the datapoints in the graph. First index will always be the datetime

statistics Union[dict, ChargerMeterGraphStatisticsDTO]

statistics based on the given date range in the format of ChargerMeterGraphStatisticsDTO

docs.title: ChargerMeterGraphStatisticsDTO
docs.text:
Attributes:

Name Type Description total_energy list

monthly total energy in kWh

peak_value list

the peak power generated in the given datetime range

peak_time list

time of which the peak power occurred

load_factor list

the average load divided by the peak load in a specified time period

latest list

latest reading from the selected device in kW

docs.title: [GET] evGraph
docs.text: /api/evGraph

docs.title: EVGraphRequestDTO
docs.text:
Attributes:

Name Type Description site_id str

id of the site

start str

start datetime of the graph

end str

end datetime of the graph

tz str

timezone of the request

graph_type str

line / bar graph

meter str

name of the charger meter

charger str

name of the charger

user_id str

id of the user logged in

docs.title: Notes
docs.text:
• The only optional parameter is the charger
  • If the difference between the start and end values are more than a day, the interval between datapoints will be 15 minutes for the line graph and 1 day for the bar graph.

The statistics object will contain the following keys:

docs.title: EVGraphResponseDTO
docs.text:
Attributes:

Name Type Description ev_data

list of lists containing the data points

order list

list of strings containing the order of the data points

statistics dict

dict containing the statistics of the data points

docs.title: EVGraphStatisticsDTO
docs.text:
Attributes:

Name Type Description duration list

duration of transactions based on ORDER

total_energy list

list of total energy based on ORDER

latest_value list

list of latest meter readings based on ORDER

peak_value list

list of peak meter readings based on ORDER

peak_time list

list of peak meter readings time based on ORDER

docs.title: Notes
docs.text:
• order represents the arrangement of the data points inside the data array. The first datapoint will always be a string literal of the datetime
  • The last element of any array will always be the total sum of the values of the datapoints before it

docs.title: [GET] siteChargers
docs.text: /api/siteChargers

docs.title: SiteChargersRequestDTO
docs.text:
Attributes:

Name Type Description site_id str

unique id assigned to the site

docs.title: SiteChargersResponseDTO
docs.text:
Attributes:

Name Type Description charger_list Union[list, SiteChargerDTO]

list of chargers and their corresponding connector statuses in the format of SiteChargerDTO

docs.title: SiteChargerDTO
docs.text:
Attributes:

Name Type Description name str

name of the charger

id str

charger id

pricing_profile int

associated pricing profile id of the charger

kw_rating float

maximum charging capacity of the charger

brand str

brand of the charger

charger_status str

status of the charger (Available/Offline/etc)

conn_status Union[list, ConnStatusDTO]

list of connector statuses and conn type

docs.title: ConnStatusDTO
docs.text:
Attributes:

Name Type Description type str

connector type

status str

connector status

docs.title: Possible Error Codes
docs.text:
• WRONG_PARAMS - Client side error. Wrong parameters were given
  • SITE_NOT_EXIST - Invalid site id given

Name Type Description email_add Annotated[str, AfterValidator(validateEmail)] first_name Annotated[str, AfterValidator(validateName)] last_name Annotated[str, AfterValidator(validateName)] rfid str phone_number Optional[str] private_access List[int]

docs.title: AddDriverResponseDTO
docs.text:
Attributes:

Name Type Description id str

docs.title: [POST] editDriver
docs.text: /api/editDriver

docs.title: EditDriverRequestDTO
docs.text:
Attributes:

Name Type Description id str email_add Annotated[Optional[str], AfterValidator(validateEmail)] first_name Annotated[Optional[str], AfterValidator(validateName)] last_name Annotated[Optional[str], AfterValidator(validateName)] rfid Optional[str] private_access List[int]

docs.title: EditDriverResponseDTO
docs.text:
Attributes:

Name Type Description id str driver_patch Dict

docs.title: [GET] transactions/ongoing
docs.text: /api/transactions/ongoing

docs.title: OngoingTransactionsRequestDTO
docs.text:
Attributes:

Name Type Description site_id str

site id of the ongoing transactions

docs.title: OngoingTransactionsResponseDTO
docs.text:
Attributes:

Name Type Description transactions list

list of ongoing transactions of type TransactionDTO

docs.title: TransactionDTO
docs.text:
Attributes:

Name Type Description reference_num str

transaction id

start_date str

start date of the transaction in the format of 'YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS'

charger_name str

charger used for the transaction

location str

location of the transaction

demand float

kWh consumed during charging session

driver str

name of the driver

duration float

duration of the charging session in hours

email str

email of the driver

payment_amount float

payment amount in PHP

payment_method str

payment method used

conn_type str

type of the connector used for the charging session

docs.title: Notes:
docs.text:
• Ongoing transactions will not have payment_amount associated with them.
  • The payment_method should still reflect what the user selected upon starting a charging session
  • The duration parameter will be continuously updated upon request.

docs.title: [GET] pricingProfiles
docs.text: /api/pricingProfiles

docs.title: PricingProfileRequestDTO
docs.text:
Attributes:

Name Type Description project_id str

project id assigned to the user

docs.title: PricingProfileResponseDTO
docs.text:
Attributes:

Name Type Description profiles List[PricingProfileDTO]

list of pricing profiles in the format of PricingProfileDTO

docs.title: PricingProfileDTO
docs.text:
Attributes:

Name Type Description id str

pricing profile id

name str

name of the pricing profile

regular dict

key value pairs of different fee types and its price

peak dict

key value pairs of different fee types and its price for peak hours

peak_hours dict

range of peak hours in PHT

docs.title: [POST] addPricingProfile
docs.text: /api/addPricingProfile

docs.title: AddPricingProfileRequestDTO
docs.text:
Attributes:

Name Type Description project_id int

the project id assigned to the user creating the request

profile ProfileDTO

Dictionary object containing the name and different pricing profiles

docs.title: ProfileDTO
docs.text:
Attributes:

Name Type Description name str

name to associate with the pricing profile

regular dict

Dictionary object containing the fee type and fee value pairs for regular pricing

peak dict

Dictionary object containing the fee type and fee value pairs for peak pricing

peak_hours dict

Dictionary object containing the peak hours

docs.title: [POST] editPricingProfile
docs.text: /api/editPricingProfile

docs.title: EditPricingProfileDTO
docs.text:
Attributes:

Name Type Description project_id int

project id assigned to the user making the request

profile EditProfileDTO

Dictionary object containing the name and different pricing profiles

docs.title: EditProfileDTO
docs.text:
Attributes:

Name Type Description id int

String representation of the profile id

name str

New name of the pricing profile

regular dict

Dictionary object containing the fee type and fee value pairs for regular pricing

peak dict

Dictionary object containing the fee type and fee value pairs for peak pricing

peak_hours dict

Dictionary object containing the peak hours

docs.title: [POST] editChargerPricing
docs.text: /api/editChargerPricing

docs.title: EditChargerPricingDTO
docs.text:
Attributes:

Name Type Description site_id int

site id assigned to the charger

changes List[ChangesDTO]

list of changes in the format of ChangesDTO

docs.title: ChangesDTO
docs.text:
Attributes:

Name Type Description charger_id str

id of the charger that is unique per site

charger_name str

name of the charger

profile_id int

profile id to be associated to the charger. This is related to pricing and can be found in EV_Pricing_Profile_History table

docs.title: [POST] deletePricingProfile
docs.text: /api/deletePricingProfile

docs.title: DeletePricingProfileRequestDTO
docs.text:
Attributes:

Name Type Description project_id int

project ID of the pricing profile id

profile_id Annotated[int, Field(gt=1)]

unique ID given to a pricing profile

docs.title: DeletePricingProfileResponseDTO
docs.text:
Attributes:

Name Type Description affected_chargers List[ChargerDTO]

a list of all affected chargers in the format of ChargerDTO

docs.title: ChargerDTO
docs.text:
Attributes:

Name Type Description site_id int

site_id assigned to the charger

charger_id str

id assigned to the charger

connector_id Annotated[int, Field(validation_alias=conn_id)]

connector of the charger affected by the change in pricing profile

straight_payments float

total straight payments in PHP

total_payments float

total payments in PHP

demand float

payment method used

conn_type str

UserTypeEnum

docs.title: [POST] createTicket
docs.text: /api/technicalSupport/createTicket

docs.title: CreateTicketRequestDTO
docs.text:
Attributes:

Name Type Description title str location_id int

Site ID

details str

docs.title: CreateTicketResponseDTO
docs.text:
Attributes:

Name Type Description ticket_id int

docs.title: Notes
docs.text: • Uploading of files will be added in the future.

docs.title: [POST] sendTicketReply
docs.text: /api/technicalSupport/sendTicketReply

docs.title: Create an API request with the following body parameters:
SendTicketReplyRequestDTO
docs.text:
Attributes:

Name Type Description ticket_id str

unique ticket identifier

message str

message to be sent

close_ticket bool

SPECIFY TRUE TO CLOSE TICKET AFTER REPLY

docs.title: The API will return a generic success / fail response where the body will be empty.
ResponseDTO
docs.text:
Attributes:

Name Type Description statusCode str

HTTP status code

body str

response body

headers dict

response headers

docs.text: Options Open Closed

docs.text:

docs.title: [GET] getTicketDetails
docs.text:
/api/technicalSupport/getTicketDetails
Form a request to get ticket messages using the following parameters:

Expect a response with the following parameters:

docs.title: TicketDetailsRequestDTO
docs.text:
Attributes:

Name Type Description ticket_id str

unique ticket identifier

docs.title: TicketDetailsResponseDTO
docs.text:
Attributes:

Name Type Description ticket_id int

unique ticket identifier

title str

ticket title

location_id int

Site ID

details str

ticket details

ticket_status str

if the ticket is open or closed

created_date_utc str

ticket creation datetime in the UTC

username str

username of the ticket creator

docs.title: [GET] getTicketMessages
docs.text:
/api/technicalSupport/getTicketMessages
Form a request to get ticket messages using the following parameters:

Expect a response with the following parameters:

Each message inside the messages array will have the following structure:

docs.title: TicketMessagesRequestDTO
docs.text:
Attributes:

Name Type Description ticket_id str

unique ticket identifier

docs.title: TicketMessagesResponseDTO
docs.text:
Attributes:

Name Type Description messages [TicketMessageDTO]

List of messages

docs.title: TicketMessageDTO
docs.text:
Attributes:

Name Type Description message str

message content

created_date_utc str

ticket creation datetime in the UTC

username str

username

docs.title: [POST] sendTicketReply
docs.text:
/api/technicalSupport/sendTicketReply

Form a request to get ticket messages using the following parameters:

Expect a generic success response with the following parameters:

docs.title: SendTicketReplyRequestDTO
docs.text:
Attributes:

Name Type Description ticket_id str

unique ticket identifier

message str

message to be sent

close_ticket bool

SPECIFY TRUE TO CLOSE TICKET AFTER REPLY

docs.title: ResponseDTO
docs.text:
Attributes:

Name Type Description statusCode str

HTTP status code

body str

response body

headers dict

response headers
